main.java.pds

Class TimeSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.pds.TimeSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Updateable

    public class TimeSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements Updateable
    Class TimeSystem is responsible for updating a set of objects that implement the Updateable interface. It also provides a set of utility functions for managing time.
    Version:
    19-Sept-2012

      TimeSystem()

      void addUpdateable(Updateable obj)

      static boolean hasTimeElapsed(double startTime, double desiredElapsedTime)
      Check to see if certain amount of time has elapsed.
      void removeUpdateable(Updateable obj)
      Remove an object from being updated every frame/iteration
      static void setTimeScale(double newTimeScale)
      For example, a timeScale of 60.0 means that every second of real-time is equivalent to 1 minute simulation time.
      void update()
      Perform an update on every added updateable.

      • hasTimeElapsed

        public static boolean hasTimeElapsed(double startTime,
                     double desiredElapsedTime)
        Check to see if certain amount of time has elapsed.
        Parameters:
        startTime - - reference time from which you wish to count in seconds.
        desiredElapsedTime - - how much time you want to pass in seconds.
        Returns:
        true if desiredElapsedTime has passed; otherwise false.

        public static double getTimeScale()
        Get the simulation time scale.
        Returns:
        the simulation time scale

      • setTimeScale

        public static void setTimeScale(double newTimeScale)
        For example, a timeScale of 60.0 means that every second of real-time is equivalent to 1 minute simulation time.
        Parameters:
        newTimeScale -
